title: Mishal Pakistan, COPAIR joins hands to improve data-driven governance
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jun 25 (APP): Mishal Pakistan, the Country Partner Institute of the World Economic Forum and the Center of Pakistan and International Relations (COPAIR) have signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) to improve policymaking in Pakistan.
The aim is to promote data-based decision-making and to institutionalize strategic foresight, data-driven governance and public policy innovation, said a press release.
The understanding reflects a shared commitment to modernize Pakistan’s institutional response to global challenges by leveraging emerging technologies, fostering narrative diplomacy, and enhancing national competitiveness.
President of COPAIR, Amna Munawwar Awan, remarked, “Pakistan’s future depends on its ability to convert intelligence into influence. This partnership will position Pakistan not just as a policy follower, but as a thought leader in areas such as AI governance, digital diplomacy, and national reform strategies. At COPAIR, we see this as the beginning of a new era of collaborative governance.”
CEO of Mishal Pakistan Amir Jahangir, said, “The World Economic Forum’s global indices are not merely scorecards, they are strategic mirrors”. Through this partnership with COPAIR, we aim to provide Pakistan the tools to see itself clearly, act courageously, and compete effectively in the global arena.”
Key areas of collaboration will be foresight reports on governance, and institutional reform, trainings for parliamentarians, media professionals, and youth on public policy and strategic communication, launching fellowships, strategic essay competitions and curriculum partnerships with universities.
The MoU will remain effective for an initial period of three years, extendable by mutual agreement.
